alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 10:00AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Inyo. Moderate to at times heavy rainfall is expected across the Death Valley National Park into the early afternoon impacting Highways 127, 178 and 190. * WHEN...Until 145 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 954 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Furnace Creek, Stovepipe Wells, Shoshone, Texas Springs Campground, Death Valley Junction, Panamint Springs, Homewood Canyon-Valley Wells, Darwin and Tecopa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
